mpletely; they may include the following:      - uroflowmetry, which measures how rapidly the bladder releases urine    - postvoid residual measurement, which evaluates how much urine remains in the bladder after urination    - reduced urine flow or residual urine in the bladder, which often suggests urine blockage due to BPH
                
More information is provided in the NIDDK health topic, Urodynamic Testing.",NIDDK,Urinary Incontinence in Men
